revised_title: A New Approach to Edge Detection in Images
tldr: The authors present a theory of edge detection in images, using a combination of filters and the second derivative of a Gaussian distribution to detect intensity changes at different scales. This method creates a raw primal sketch, which is a primitive description of the image, and helps in understanding the goals of early image analysis in vision. The theory explains several psychophysical findings and provides a basis for a physiological model of simple cells in the visual cortex.
